channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Four Things That Helped Banks Haul in Huge Profits in 2024
item.description: How lenders managed to rake in more than investors expected in a year when interest rates started falling and Donald Trump was elected president.

item.title: Citigroup swings to fourth-quarter profit, tops estimates on investment banking strength
item.description: The fourth-quarter report comes after a year where Citi's stock rose almost 37%, outperforming the S&P 500.

item.title: American Express to Pay $230 Million in Fines for Aggressive Sales Practices
item.description: The Wall Street Journal had reported on a series of deceptive and strong-arm tactics the card company used to increase small business sign-ups.

item.title: What Happens When Your House Burns Down and You Still Have a Mortgage?
item.description: Borrowers are still on the hook but might be able to pause payments.

item.title: TSMC net profit hits record high as fourth-quarter results top expectations on robust AI chip demand
item.description: TSMC, the world's largest contract chip manufacturer, produces advanced processors for clients such as Nvidia and Apple and has benefited from the meg...

item.title: Bank of America tops estimates on better-than-expected investment banking, interest income
item.description: The company said fourth-quarter profit more than doubled to $6.67 billion, or 82 cents per share, from a year earlier.

item.title: Dow Slips; Investors Dig Into More Bank Earnings
item.description: The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow industrials were pulled lower by declines in large tech shares. Bank of America and Morgan Stanley said profit more than d...

item.title: Fixed-Income Investors Wrestle With Higher Yields Ahead of Inauguration
item.description: Bond investors are in for a bumpier ride than usual, as Treasury yields are expected to move sharply in the coming weeks on the heels of an unpredicta...

item.title: Shares of Cartier owner Richemont jump 16% as sales rise in December quarter
item.description: Cartier owner Richemont on Thursday reported a 10% increase in third quarter sales even as China demand weighed.

item.title: Morgan Stanley tops estimates on strong equities and fixed income trading revenue
item.description: While bank stocks have been supported by enthusiasm for rising deal activity, it was actually the trading side that helped Morgan Stanley more in the ...
